name: Magnolia Jane
climate: Magnolia Jane thrives in temperate climates with mild winters and warm summers.
This plant prefers areas with high humidity and consistent rainfall throughout the year.
It can tolerate cold climates but does best when protected from harsh winter winds.
Adaptable to various climates, but extreme heat or cold can cause stress to the plant.
sunlight: Prefers full sun to partial shade for optimal growth and flowering.
Can tolerate dappled shade, but too much shade may reduce blooms.
Needs at least 6 hours of direct sunlight daily to thrive and produce flowers.
In very hot climates, some afternoon shade can prevent leaf scorch.
watering: Requires consistent moisture, especially during the growing season of spring and summer.
Soil should be kept evenly moist, but not waterlogged, to prevent root rot.
During dry periods, additional watering is essential to maintain health.
Reduce watering in winter, as the plant requires less during dormancy.
soil: Prefers well-drained, slightly acidic to neutral soil for best growth.
Soil should be rich in organic matter and retain some moisture without becoming soggy.
Avoid compacted soil to ensure proper root aeration and penetration.
Sandy loam or loamy soil types are ideal for Magnolia Jane's root development.
toxic: The plant is generally non-toxic to humans and pets, making it safe for gardens.
extra_care_tip: Prune after flowering to shape and remove damaged or crossing branches.
